bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, January 27, 1941

div1.p: Hutchison apologizes for not being able to send the requested number of reprints. He suggests asking Pew for a donation toward the yellow fever memorial in Havana. Hutchison promises that Mabel Lazear will receive a copy of the program and memorial plate honoring her husband.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, January 27, 1941
div1.opener:
3/6/41-sent
come
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
January 27, 1941
Dear Phil:
div1.p:
In regard to the Mile Post, to which you
refer in your letter, I myself did not know what they
were putting into it. Mr. McClain got authority to
print it and I never thought about it again. It turns
out that he included your speech, (which I wouldn't
seriously have protested had I known it was to go in)
and a great deal of other material, including your
name! It was very dumb of us not to think of having
reprints made of your speech and article in order that
you might send them out, but we didn't think about it
and it's too late now. Furthermore, we do not have more
than a few copies of this or of the Alumni Bulletin,
and I am terribly sorry about it. It is just too late
to do anything. As soon as I got your letter we
telephoned down to the printers to see whether by chance
they had left that print set up but it had all been torn
down. If you feel that it is important enough for these
seventy or eighty people who have assisted you, I think
that we might make a special printing of it. I could
at least look into the expense of such a printing and
I will do that.

I think you should tackle Mr. Pew for money
toward that memorial and I see no reason for you to
hesitate. The address is Mr. J. Howard Pew, Sun Oil
Building 1608 Walnut Street, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
I hope that you may get the whole amount needed from
Mr. Pew as I suspect that he is able to give it.

We did not send the brochure to Mrs. Lazear
so far as I know, but I am sending a memo and asking
them to do so. We failed to send a plate and therefore
since it has gone this long and you are getting in touch
with her, we are sending a plate and you can write to her
and tell her that you are sending it.

I understand that Buddy is going to spend a day
there after he visits out at Huron, South Dakota. I wish
I could be there the same day but there doesn't appear to
be much chance. Some day I'll just pass out for lack of a
doctor!

Give my regards to Buddy when he comes and
I will be trying to get out there some time. Our love
to the family.
div1.closer:
Affectionately yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
RCH/M
